paper_abstract: The sharp Jackson inequality between the best approximation of f epsilon L-2([0, 1], x(2v+1)) by a subspace (n)-which pound is the linear hull of a finite orthogonal system of the functions constructed by the Bessel function of order v of the first kind and its zeros-of L-2([0, 1], x(2v+1)) and the generalized continuous modulus of order alpha > 0 of the generalized derivative off defined by a multiplier for some case with t > 0 is established. Moreover, the exact values of the n-widths of the function classes S(alpha, lambda, psi) and S(alpha, lambda) in the space L-2([0, 1], x(2v+1)) are obtained. (c) 2012 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: The Jackson inequality and widths of function classes in L-2([0,1], x(2v+1))
